banner.title: TP WorkLife 10/12
banner.mainContentHeadline: The podcast where science meets business
banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: Solving the sanitation crisis

nodes.whoTheyAre: John Kluge Jr. is an entrepreneur who started for-profit angel investment firm, Eirene, to support issues that will impact at least one billion people. He also co-founded Toilet Hackers, a non-profit organization committed to raising awareness and providing access to dignified sanitation to the 2.5 billion people without a toilet. Kluge espouses a PhilanthroPunk philosophy -- punk rock attitude applied to philanthropy at a mass scale.

videoData.description: The lack of private and fully functioning toilets threatens the health and welfare of too many people. John Kluge, co-founder of Toilet Hackers, explains that access to toilets affects everything from education to the economy, and offers some workable solutions to address the crisis.
